meanings.definition: A structural unit of a eukaryotic chromosome, consisting of a length of DNA coiled around a core of histones.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the nucleosomes under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The nucleosomes play a crucial role in gene regulation.
meanings.sent3: The nucleosomes at the party were all tightly packed together.
meanings.sent4: The nucleosomes acted like tiny spools winding up the DNA thread.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to explain how nucleosomes organize DNA.

meanings.definition: A complex of DNA and histone proteins, found in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The nucleosomes were visible in the cell nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the structure of nucleosomes in detail.
meanings.sent3: The nucleosomes in the nucleus were having a dance party.
meanings.sent4: The nucleosomes in the cell nucleus resembled a tightly packed bookshelf.
meanings.sent5: The student visualized nucleosomes as tiny beads on a string in biology class.
